p: Thyme contains monoterpene phenols, including carvacrol (iso-propyl-ortho-cresol; 0.4–20.6%), thymol (2-isopropyl-5-methylphenol or iso-propylmeta-cresol; C10H14O; 10–64%) and p-cymene (9.1–22.2%), and other monoterpenes, such as α-pinene (0.9–6.6%), 1,8-cineole (0.2–14.2%), camphor (0–7.3%), linalool (2.2–4.8%) and borneol (0.6–7.5%) [ 16].
